history.content:
Unfortunately, only you can decide whether to join the waitlist now or not. In the past, CS 61C has expanded but we are more budget-constrained that ever for F21 so do not plan that enrollment will expand (significantly if at all) in F21.

You can see past history on www.berkeleytime.com re: enrollments but again, this semester is fairly unique. Budgets are more constrained & it will be the first time back in person in a few semesters.

The reason a waitlist currently exists is due to the reserve capacities. If you add up the enrolled plus the waitlisted students, you see it's fewer than the current enrollment cap - which means, if you join the WL now, your odds of getting in are very good. Who knows what that will be during phase 2.

Currently there are 169 students on the waitlist.

If I wait until Phase 2 to enroll will I still make it? Will/does 61C usually expand?

Do I still have a chance if I enroll now at 170+ on the waitlist?
history.subject: CS61C Enrollment as Undeclared LSCS
